publicFunctions.brief: Set the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) to the "closed" state, which disables all blocking/async synchronization on the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/), immediately unblocking any currently waiting tasks/threads.
publicFunctions.details: This method is safe to call multiple times. The [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) value can still be modified and retrieved after it is closed; this only disables the methods in the "Synchronization" category (see Summary section above).
publicFunctions.name: close
publicFunctions.summary: Set the Watch to the "closed" state, which disables all blocking/async synchronization on the Watch, immediately unblocking any currently waiting tasks/threads.
publicFunctions.title: close

publicFunctions.brief: Wakes up all observers of this [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/), invoking their handlers with StatusCode::kPoke to indicate they should check their current situation and possibly retry.
publicFunctions.name: poke
publicFunctions.summary: Wakes up all observers of this Watch, invoking their handlers with StatusCode::kPoke to indicate they should check their current situation and possibly retry.
publicFunctions.title: poke

publicFunctions.details: NOT safe to call when updating the value may cause the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) to be destroyed on some other thread.

publicFunctions.summary: Atomically set the value of the Watch.

publicFunctions.brief: Same as set_value, but safe to call even when setting the value may cause the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) object to be destroyed.
publicFunctions.details: Using this function instead of `set_value` probably implies its a bad idea to make any future reference to the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) object after `set_value_and_release` returns.
publicFunctions.name: set_value_and_release
publicFunctions.summary: Same as set_value, but safe to call even when setting the value may cause the Watch object to be destroyed.
publicFunctions.title: set_value_and_release

publicFunctions.summary: Atomically sets the Watch value to the bitwise-and of the current value and the passed arg, returning the previous value.
publicFunctions.title: fetch_and

publicFunctions.brief: Atomically modifies the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) value by applying the passed transform `fn`.
publicFunctions.details:
`fn`**MUST** be safe to call multiple times within a single call to `modify`. This is because `modify` may be implemented via an atomic compare-and-swap loop.

_NOTE: This behavior is acknowledged to be less than ideal and will be fixed in the future to be consistent, regardless of `T`_
publicFunctions.name: modify
returns: if `T` is a primitive integer type (including `bool`), the new value of the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/); else, the old value of the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/)
publicFunctions.summary: Atomically modifies the Watch value by applying the passed transform fn.
publicFunctions.title: modify

publicFunctions.brief: Does an atomic compare-and-swap operation on the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) value.
publicFunctions.details: If the watch is equal to `old_value`, then it will be set to `new_value` and this function will return true. Otherwise, `old_value` will be updated with the observed value and this function will return false.
publicFunctions.name: compare_exchange
publicFunctions.summary: Does an atomic compare-and-swap operation on the Watch value.
publicFunctions.title: compare_exchange

publicFunctions.brief: Retries `fn` on the watch value until it succeeds or the watch is closed.
publicFunctions.details:
Return the old (pre-modify) value on which `fn` finally succeeded.

`fn` should have the signature (T) -> Optional<T>. Returning None indicates `fn` should not be called again until a new value is available.

`fn`**MUST** be safe to call multiple times within a single call to `await_modify`. This is because `await_modify` may be implemented via an atomic compare-and-swap loop.
publicFunctions.name: await_modify
returns:
* If successful, the old (pre-modify) value on which `fn` finally succeeded
* `batt::StatusCode::kClosed` if the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) was closed before `fn` was successful
publicFunctions.summary: Retries fn on the watch value until it succeeds or the watch is closed.
publicFunctions.title: await_modify

publicFunctions.brief: Conditionally modify the value of the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/).
publicFunctions.details:
Retries calling `fn` on the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) value until EITHER of:

* `fn` returns `batt::None`
* BOTH of:
    * `fn` returns a non-`batt::None` value
    * the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) value is atomically updated via compare-and-swap
`fn`**MUST** be safe to call multiple times within a single call to `modify_if`. This is because `modify_if` may be implemented via an atomic compare-and-swap loop.

Unlike batt::Watch::await_modify, this method never puts the current task/thread to sleep; it keeps _actively_ polling the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) value until it reaches one of the exit criteria described above.
publicFunctions.name: modify_if
returns: The final value returned by `fn`, which is either `batt::None` or the new [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) value.
publicFunctions.summary: Conditionally modify the value of the Watch.
publicFunctions.title: modify_if

publicFunctions.brief: Invokes the passed handler `fn` with the described value as soon as one of the following conditions is true:
publicFunctions.details:
* When the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) value is _not_ equal to the passed value `last_seen`, invoke `fn` with the current value of the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/).
* When the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) is closed, invoke `fn` with `batt::StatusCode::kClosed`.
publicFunctions.name: async_wait
publicFunctions.summary: Invokes the passed handler fn with the described value as soon as one of the following conditions is true:
publicFunctions.title: async_wait

publicFunctions.brief: Blocks the current task/thread until the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) value is _not_ equal to `last_seen`.
publicFunctions.name: await_not_equal
returns: On success, the current value of the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/), which is guaranteed to _not_ equal `last_seen`, else `batt::StatusCode::kClosed` if the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) was closed before a satisfactory value was observed
publicFunctions.summary: Blocks the current task/thread until the Watch value is not equal to last_seen.
publicFunctions.title: await_not_equal

publicFunctions.brief: Blocks the current task/thread until the passed predicate function returns `true` for the current value of the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/).
publicFunctions.details: This is the most general of [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/)'s blocking getter methods.
publicFunctions.name: await_true
returns: On success, the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) value for which `pred` returned `true`, else `batt::StatusCode::kClosed` if the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) was closed before a satisfactory value was observed
publicFunctions.summary: Blocks the current task/thread until the passed predicate function returns true for the current value of the Watch.
publicFunctions.title: await_true

publicFunctions.brief: Blocks the current task/thread until the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) contains the specified value.
publicFunctions.name: await_equal
returns:
One of the following:

* `batt::OkStatus()` if the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) value was observed to be `val`
* `batt::StatusCode::kClosed` if the [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/) was closed before `val` was observed
publicFunctions.summary: Blocks the current task/thread until the Watch contains the specified value.
publicFunctions.title: await_equal

publicFunctions.brief: Modify the value to be at least `lower_bound`.
publicFunctions.name: clamp_min_value

paramList.name: lower_bound
paramList.text: The (inclusive) lower bound value to enforce

paramList.name: order_fn
paramList.text: A callable object taking two T values and returning bool that returns true iff the first argument is less-than the second.

publicFunctions.summary: Modify the value to be at least lower_bound.
publicFunctions.title: clamp_min_value

paramList.name: order_fn
paramList.text: A callable object taking two T values and returning bool that returns true iff the first argument is less-than the second.

publicFunctions.summary: Modify the value to be at most upper_bound.
publicFunctions.title: clamp_max_value

publicFunctions.brief: Modify the value to be at least `lower_bound`, using the default ordering for T.
publicFunctions.name: clamp_min_value
publicFunctions.summary: Modify the value to be at least lower_bound, using the default ordering for T.
publicFunctions.title: clamp_min_value

publicFunctions.brief: Modify the value to be at most `upper_bound`, using the default ordering for T.
publicFunctions.name: clamp_max_value
publicFunctions.summary: Modify the value to be at most upper_bound, using the default ordering for T.
publicFunctions.title: clamp_max_value

publicFunctions.brief: Yields control of the current task to allow other tasks to potentially modify this [Watch](/_autogen/Classes/classbatt_1_1Watch/), returning the post-resume value of this; for busy-polling.
publicFunctions.name: poll
publicFunctions.summary: Yields control of the current task to allow other tasks to potentially modify this Watch, returning the post-resume value of this; for busy-polling.
